body: If we build microsoft-reactnative-sampleapps in x64 release, it will crash during the launch, due to .net native optimized away CustomUserControlViewManagerCS(IReactContext reactContext).

title: Add SourceLink support to vnext for automatic symbol and source loading while debugging

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
[Source Link](https://github.com/dotnet/sourcelink) is a technology built by VS and officially supported by Microsoft to enable automatic source loading while debugging. 

RNW should integrate Source Link to improve the debugging experience for projects consuming RNW. 

For reference, it was integrated into winui in this pull request https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/pull/606

We can use it:
1. screenshot on fail
2. visual diff.

It doesn't like a standard WebDriver API, and it may need additional work make JS happy.

Here is C# example of screenshot:
https://github.com/microsoft/WinAppDriver/blob/master/Tests/WebDriverAPI/Screenshot.cs

title: Bundled images assets in appxs aren't found

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
Right now, we hardcode ReactUWP to expect packaged bundles to be in `ms-appx://Bundle/{filename}.bundle`

The developer passes in `{filename}`.

So if you run `react-native bundle --platform uwp--entry-file index.js --bundle-output Bundle\index.uwp.bundle --assets-dest Bundle` to get:

```
Bundle\
- index.uwp.bundle
  assets\
    - asset1.png
    - asset2.png
```

However, when loading images, we translate the path `file://assets/asset1.png` to `ms-appx:///assets/asset1.png`

title: Miscellaneous fixes in ETW tracing + Systrace
body:
This PR is meant to backport the changes in the https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/pull/3745 to 0.59-vnext-stable, and hence to devmain immediately.

1. Removing some pre-processing on systrace events before writing to ETW provider. We added them for easier analysis through WPA. BUt, We now have tool (JS HUD) which can process the raw events offline. 
2. Adding a unique id per Systrace section which allows us to match the start and end events.
3. Some renaming and documentation on the macros for better readability.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/pull/3746)

title: Alert:  prompt API is not implemented

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
RN Alert has a prompt API which isn't yet implemented in RN4W.

Note that the Facebook docs are incorrect.  The docs say AlertiOS has a prompt API but it's actually on Alert.  To add to the confusion, this API is only implemented on iOS.

See:  https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/alertios#prompt
and https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/master/Libraries/Alert/Alert.js

We should implement the missing API on Windows, and we should follow up with Facebook about getting an Android implementation.

body:
In the windows implementation of Alert, we currently have 'OK' hard-coded in English in the javascript.  This should be localized.  iOS does this on the native side, we should probably copy this pattern.

See vnext/src/libraries/alert/alert.windows.js

title: XamlIslands readiness:  code audit

Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
In order to make RN4W work correctly when used in a XamlIsland context we need to avoid using certain XAML APIs.

This issue is tracking doing a code audit for all "non-xaml-Islands-friendly" APIs.  We'll need to use "xaml-islands-friendly" equivalents to meet the requirement.  I expect we'll find some code that needs to be converted.  We can track those with follow-up bugs.

The doc that has the list of APIs is here:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/specstore/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B45E349E7-0241-4B31-B535-BABCC40575AD%7D&file=%5B17468132%5D%20Xaml%20Islands%20ContentRoot%20API%20Spec.docx&wdLOR=c2A16AF8C-CD56-4096-A2DF-4109E715BD47&action=default&mobileredirect=true

Note carefully that this doc doesn't cover APIs that require package identity, which won't work in a win32 context.  There isn't a definitive doc on which APIs do require package identity, but we have this:

MikeHillberg says:  Heres some data from Tanaka (Jimha), manually collected (theres no tooling for this), circa I think 19h1 or Vb (so its a longer list for earlier versions). My take overall: not as bad as I expected.

title: M4: Reconcile Microsoft.ReactNative and ReactUWP

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body:
`Microsoft.ReactNative.dll` is the new entry-point for React Native Windows developers. It is built on top of the "old" `ReactUWP.dll`.

The surface of `ReactUWP.dll` is a mix of standard exports with headers, an incomplete C++/WinRT winmd, etc.

The end goal is for `Microsoft.ReactNative.dll` to subsume and replace `ReactUWP.dll`, providing one, clean, WinRT entry-point. However there are existing partners shipping on top of `ReactUWP.dll`, so we need to make sure that they aren't left hanging until they can migrate.

title: Unable to activate WinRT types in ReactUWP created using buildcppwinrt.cmd

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
Right now, we are not consuming cppwinrt properly in the ReactUWP project. We are running the tools manually to generate the files based on the idls (using a buildcppwinrt.cmd script), but those generated classes aren't part of the DLL's WINRT_GetActivationFactory, and so can't be RoActivated.

This means for a type winrt::react::uwp::Example, you'' get a runtime error if you try

`auto example = winrt::react::uwp::Example()`

Instead, (and only ReactUWP can do this) you have to call:

`auto example = winrt::make<winrt::react::uwp::implementation::Example>()`

This also means you can't access static methods/properties on those types, as it requires a runtime activation.

This bug will be fixed when we redo all of the cppwinrt code, but in the meantime I'm using this issue number to track the places in the code where we're working around this limitation by calling the implementation class directly, instead of the projected class.

title: Image progressiveRenderingEnabled

body:
Split out from #2111
https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/image#progressiverenderingenabled

_Typically Android only. When true, enables progressive jpeg streaming. [See here](https://frescolib.org/docs/progressive-jpegs.html)._
Not supported by XAML. Would need to do the decoding ourselves and render ourselves.

When true, enables progressive jpeg streaming. https://frescolib.org/docs/progressive-jpegs.html

title: Provide separate dev setting for hostname and port

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body: Instead of having a single dev setting for the hostname and port together, e.g. "localhost:123", provide separate settings for "hostname" and "port". This would allow changing the port while using the default for the host name (localhost), and would be easier for tooling.

title: Make vNext the default

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body:
- The vNext C++ implementation of RNW should be the default implementation
- The C# implementation currently known as vCurrent should still be accessible to unblock developers currently dependent on it and developers who can't use vNext (as there will be areas where our API completion doesn't line up 100%)
- It may be worthwhile to keep a prev|next|current breakdown for future breaking changes, although given the sheer number of references to "vnext" it may be confusing to rebrand.

title: Support react-native-fs for RNW vNext

labels.name: Deliverable
labels.description: Major item tracked for top-level planning in ADO

body:
Cannot read property 'RNFSFileTypeRegular' of undefined

react-native-fs has a RNFSManager which has some constants and other fairly low level stuff.
There is a /windows module but it is using cs and is designed for RNWcurrent and so RNWvNext and it's use of 'uwp' makes this not work.

https://github.com/itinance/react-native-fs/tree/master/windows/RNFS


Also rn-fetch-blob doesn't have windows support.  And it is sorta related to file system things. 
https://github.com/joltup/rn-fetch-blob

title: Is there are any way to call function from props?

labels.name: Extensions
labels.description: Tracks issues against community modules and extensions

body:
I want to call function from props in windows Native Module.

I already tried two ways:
  1) UIManagerModule().EventDispatcher.DispatchEvent(Event)
  In this case I need to edit UIManagerModule.Constants.cs file, because function has custom name (does not meet another event name)

  2) RCTDeviceEventEmitter().emit(Event)
  But in this method I need to add listener to JS module's file.

Can I invoke function in some other way?

<!-- (What platform are you building for? Choose any from UWP, WPF) -->
- Target Platform: UWP

<!-- (What framework version are you building for? Choose from 10.0.14393, 10.0.10586, 10.0.10240, etc. (UWP), .NET 4.6.1, .NET 4.5, etc. (WPF) -->
- Target Platform Version(s): 10.0.16299.0

<!-- (What device(s) are you targeting? Choose any from Desktop, Mobile (ARM), Mobile Emulator, Xbox, Hololens) -->
- Target Device(s): Desktop

<!-- Which operating system are you using? Specify macOS, Windows, or Linux, along with specific release versions -->
- Development Operating System: Windows

<!-- Which version of Visual Studio are you using? Specify Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2017 -->
- Visual Studio Version: 2017 Community

<!-- Which build configuration are you running? Choose from Debug, DebugBundle, Release, ReleaseBundle -->
- Build Configuration: ReleaseBundle

### Steps to Reproduce

(Write your steps here:)

1. Attempt to generate the APPX bundle from either within VS or using msbuild on command line

### Expected Behavior

The APPX bundle would be created in a timely fashion.

### Actual Behavior

APPX bundle is taking in excess of an hour to be built. 

### Reproducible Demo

Repo available here: https://github.com/nelsona/windows-rn59-testapp

Running the following msbuild:
```
msbuild testApp.sln -t:restore /t:Clean;Build /t:testApp /p:OutputPath=./build;Configuration=ReleaseBundle;AppxBundle=Always;AppxBundlePlatforms="x64|ARM|x86";AppxPackageDir="build\\AppxPackages\\";UapAppxPackageBuildMode=StoreUpload
```
command shows the build getting stuck during the Processing application code section. Checking in task manager shows the .NET Native Compiler Toolchain process is running and doesn't seem to finish.

title: Investigate the integration with nodejs 12.13

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body:
All of our testing and setup are based on nodejs 10, but now nodejs stable version is 12.13.0.
We experienced error with 12.13 before. Although problem is not in our code, but we are impacted and can't start the metro bundle server.

Here is the error
>yarn run start
$ react-native start
error Invalid regular expression: /(.*\\__fixtures__\\.*|node_modules[\\\]react[\\\]dist[\\\].*|website\\node_modules\\.*|heapCapture\\bundle\.js|.*\\__tests__\\.*)$/: Unterminated character class. Run CLI with --verbose flag for more details.
SyntaxError: Invalid regular expression: /(.*\\__fixtures__\\.*|node_modules[\\\]react[\\\]dist[\\\].*|website\\node_modules\\.*|heapCapture\\bundle\.js|.*\\__tests__\\.*)$/: Unterminated character class
    at new RegExp (<anonymous>)
    at blacklist (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\metro-config\src\defaults\blacklist.js:34:10)
    at getBlacklistRE (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\@react-native-community\cli\build\tools\loadMetroConfig.js:69:59)
    at getDefaultConfig (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\@react-native-community\cli\build\tools\loadMetroConfig.js:84:20)
    at load (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\@react-native-community\cli\build\tools\loadMetroConfig.js:112:25)
    at Object.runServer [as func] (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\@react-native-community\cli\build\commands\server\runServer.js:82:58)
    at Command.handleAction (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\@react-native-community\cli\build\cliEntry.js:160:21)
    at Command.listener (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\commander\index.js:315:8)
    at Command.emit (events.js:210:5)
    at Command.parseArgs (f:\repo\react-native-windows\node_modules\commander\index.js:651:12)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.

title: Support react-native-video on RNW vNext

labels.name: Extensions
labels.description: Tracks issues against community modules and extensions

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body:
@harinikmsft Here's the issue

I want to start experimenting with video support in a React Native Windows project.
To stream play all of the content I'm interested in the video player would need to support mpeg dash and Microsoft smooth streaming.

There is an existing project that adds support for video to the C# React Native Windows implementation. I'm not sure if it makes more sense to update the existing [react-native-video](https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-video) to work with RNWCPP or if it should live in this repo. Just wanted to point out that it exists :)

title: Enable wrapping of NavigationView/TabView like controls

milestone.title: WinUI3 (vNext M6)
milestone.description: This milestone builds upon MVP to leverage [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3) to fill in the feature gaps and complete implementation of RNW core APIs.

body:
This issue was discovered by Office folks when they attempted to wrap the XAML TwoPaneView. The issue occurs when you have this sort of arrangement: 
[WrappedControl]
  [Component /]
  [etc]
[/WrappedControl]
In this situation, the WrappedControl runs layout in XAML which flexbox has no knowledge of. Inside the WrappedControl are react-native components which need flexbox to layout correctly. This doesn't currently work because flexbox is "stomping over" the properties that XAML is supposed to be in control of. We know of several WinUI controls that behave similarly to TwoPaneView (NavigationView and TabView). So this will be a general problem moving forward if we want to wrap those types of controls. There does appear to be a way to resolve the conflict - we'd need to let XAML participate in the overall layout process and override flexbox when necessary. Note that this solution would need to take the upcoming Fabric change into consideration - in that world, layout is running off of the UI thread, so letting XAML override becomes more difficult. This issue is tracking solving this general problem.

title: autoFocus for TextInput should automatically open virtual keyboard

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body: This is a request/would like to have from Xbox. When you enable the autoFocus property on TextInput it should also open up the virtual keyboard once focus has been placed into the input box.
